instruments Module¶

The instruments module contains functions to open and close VISA or NI-DAQ instruments. It keeps track of all the instruments that are loaded and attributes them unique shortnames. Loaded instruments are stored in the __loaded__ dictionary.

pyslave.instruments.openinstr(address, id=None, shortname=None)¶

Open the instrument at the specified VISA address. The address must be a valid VISA resource. If id is None, the instrument id is queried. If no driver is found for the corresponding id, a generic instrument is returned otherwise an instance of the found driver class is returned. The function also sets the fullname and shortname attributes automatically (unless shortname is specified).

pyslave.instruments.opennidaq(devname, id=None, shortname=None)¶

Open the NI-DAQ device with the specified name. If id is None, the device id is queried. If no driver is found for the corresponding id, an error is raised otherwise an instance of the found driver class is returned. The function also sets the fullname and shortname attributes automatically (unless shortname is specified).

pyslave.instruments.openall(match, resource='visa')¶

Open all instruments whose address contains match in the given resource. For example, openall(‘GPIB’, resource=’visa’) loads all GPIB devices and return them in a list. Or openall(‘Mod’,resource=’nidaq’) loads all NI-DAQ modules in a rack.

pyslave.instruments.closeinstr(shortname)¶

Close the instrument specified by its shortname and remove it from the instrument list.
